docs.abstract: The company showed off a slate of new computers with better screens, faster processors and higher price tags.
docs.snippet: The company showed off a slate of new computers with better screens, faster processors and higher price tags.
docs.lead_paragraph: Apple showed off a slate of new computers with better screens, faster processors and higher price tags on Tuesday, including an iPad Pro that the company is trying to position as a primary work computer.

headline.main: Apple Unveils New iPad and MacBook Air
headline.print_headline: Apple Pushes Newest iPad  As a Main Work Computer

docs.abstract: The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission is investigating the ride-hailing company’s hiring and pay practices.
docs.snippet: The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission is investigating the ride-hailing company’s hiring and pay practices.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Federal officials are investigating allegations that Uber discriminated against women in hiring and pay, another federal inquiry into a company that has been rocked by scandals over its workplace culture and other issues.

headline.main: Uber Is Target of Federal Sex Discrimination Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Uber Is Target of Federal Sex Discrimination Inquiry

docs.abstract: Profits rose by nearly a third in the latest quarter, Apple said, news that could soon make the tech giant the first public company worth more than $1 trillion.
docs.snippet: Profits rose by nearly a third in the latest quarter, Apple said, news that could soon make the tech giant the first public company worth more than $1 trillion.
docs.lead_paragraph: Apple reported another strong quarter of profits on Tuesday, as consumers kept buying iPhones and paying more for them, news that could soon help make the Silicon Valley giant the first public company to be worth more than $1 trillion.

headline.main: Apple Could Soon Be Worth $1 Trillion as Profits Pour In
headline.print_headline: More Profits Could Send Apple Past $1 Trillion

docs.abstract: Apple’s C.E.O. slammed his Silicon Valley peers for building a “data industrial complex” but his speech requires context.
docs.snippet: Apple’s C.E.O. slammed his Silicon Valley peers for building a “data industrial complex” but his speech requires context.
docs.lead_paragraph: Each week, technology reporters and columnists from The New York Times review the week’s news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry. Want this newsletter in your inbox? Sign up here.

headline.main: The Week in Tech: Apple Goes on the Attack
headline.print_headline: Apple Chief Has Harsh Words for Tech Rivals

docs.abstract: Amazon announced more than a dozen devices and tools for its Alexa voice assistant, including a microwave.
docs.snippet: Amazon announced more than a dozen devices and tools for its Alexa voice assistant, including a microwave.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — If you’re one of the millions of people without a smart speaker in your home, Amazon wants to talk to you.

headline.main: Hey, Alexa, Why is Amazon Making a Microwave?

docs.abstract: The money, put into a project he called the Day 1 Fund, is by far the largest donation by Mr. Bezos, the world’s richest person.
docs.snippet: The money, put into a project he called the Day 1 Fund, is by far the largest donation by Mr. Bezos, the world’s richest person.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Amazon founder and chief executive, Jeff Bezos, and his wife, MacKenzie, pledged $2 billion on Thursday for a new fund to start preschools and help homeless families.

headline.main: Jeff and MacKenzie Bezos Pledge $2 Billion for Homeless and Preschoolers
headline.print_headline: Bezos and Wife Pledge $2 Billion for Preschoolers and the Homeless

docs.abstract: The company also said it would lobby the federal government for a higher minimum wage.
docs.snippet: The company also said it would lobby the federal government for a higher minimum wage.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Amazon said on Tuesday that it would raise the minimum wage to $15 an hour for its United States employees, a rare acknowledgment that it was feeling squeezed by political pressure and a tight labor market. The raises apply for part-time workers and those hired through temporary agencies.

headline.main: Amazon to Raise Minimum Wage to $15 for All U.S. Workers
headline.print_headline: Amazon Raises Minimum Pay To $15 an Hour

docs.abstract: Microsoft beat analyst expectations and its own guidance across every segment of its business.
docs.snippet: Microsoft beat analyst expectations and its own guidance across every segment of its business.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Apple has its cash cow, the iPhone, which has made it the world’s largest public company. Amazon transformed an array of industries, from logistics to the way consumers buy, to become the second largest. For Microsoft, which is gaining ground on Amazon, growth runs straight through the cloud.

headline.main: Microsoft’s Earnings Surge, as Cloud Bet Continues to Pay Off
headline.print_headline: Bet on Cloud Is Paying Off for Microsoft

docs.abstract: Lost faith in Facebook and Instagram after data leakages, breaches and too much noise? Here’s a guide to breaking up with the social network and its photo-sharing app for good.
docs.snippet: Lost faith in Facebook and Instagram after data leakages, breaches and too much noise? Here’s a guide to breaking up with the social network and its photo-sharing app for good.
docs.lead_paragraph: You may have decided enough is enough: It’s time to delete Facebook.

headline.main: How to Delete Facebook and Instagram From Your Life Forever
headline.print_headline: Making the Break From Facebook In 6 Steps

docs.abstract: The social network’s total user numbers may be slow to grow, but that isn’t dampening investor enthusiasm for the company. For now, anyway.
docs.snippet: The social network’s total user numbers may be slow to grow, but that isn’t dampening investor enthusiasm for the company. For now, anyway.
docs.lead_paragraph: Get the DealBook newsletter to make sense of major business and policy headlines — and the power-brokers who shape them.

headline.main: Confidence in Twitter Is Growing, and Its Stock Is Up — But Can It Keep Going?
